<xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Request package is typically used to supply parameters for 'get' requests</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:element name="StartTime" type="xs:dateTime" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Start time of interest</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="EndTime" type="xs:dateTime" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>End time of interest</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="Option" type="OptionType" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Request type specialization</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="ID" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Object ID for request</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:complexType> <xs:simpleContent> <xs:extension base="xs:string"> <xs:attributeGroup ref="IDatts"/> </xs:extension> </xs:simpleContent> </xs:complexType> </xs:element> <xs:any namespace="##other" processContents="lax" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>This can be a CIM profile defined as an XSD with a CIM-specific namespace This may also be used for custom extensions.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:any> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="ReplyType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Reply type definition</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Reply package is used to confirm success or report errors</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:element name="Result"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Reply code: OK, PARTIAL or FAILED</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:simpleType> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:enumeration value="OK"/> <xs:enumeration value="PARTIAL"/> <xs:enumeration value="FAILED"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> </xs:element> <xs:element name="Error" type="ErrorType" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Reply details describing one or more errors</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="ID" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Resulting transaction ID (usually consequence of create)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:complexType> <xs:simpleContent> <xs:extension base="xs:string"> <xs:attributeGroup ref="IDatts"/> </xs:extension> </xs:simpleContent> </xs:complexType> </xs:element> <xs:any namespace="##other" processContents="lax" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Used for custom extensions</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:any> <xs:element name="operationId" type="xs:integer" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The reply.operationId provides the unique identifier of the Operation for which this reply.result is relevant. Thus, it is assumed that this is a partial reply in direct response to one of the operations contained in an OperationSet request.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="PayloadType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Payload container</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:choice> <xs:any namespace="##other" processContents="skip" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>For XML payloads, usually CIM profiles defined using an XSD in a profile-specific namespace. May also be used for custom extensions.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:any> <xs:element name="OperationSet" type="OperationSet" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Each operation set is a collection of operations that may require operational-integrity and/or sequence control.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="Compressed" type="xs:string" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>For compressed and/or binary, uuencoded payloads If compressed, Gzip compression is used.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="ID" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Used to supply object IDs for cancel/close/delete operations in cases where they are not otherwise specified using a type-specific payload</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:complexType> <xs:simpleContent> <xs:extension base="xs:string"> <xs:attributeGroup ref="IDatts"/> </xs:extension> </xs:simpleContent> </xs:complexType> </xs:element> </xs:choice> <xs:element name="Format" type="xs:string" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Hint as to format of payload, e.g. XML, RDF, SVF, BINARY, PDF, ...</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="OperationType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>For master data set synchronization XML payloads.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="operationId" type="xs:integer"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The payload.operation.operationId provides the unique identifier (within the OperationSet) of the Operation for the purpose of reference in subsequent messages (e.g. OperationSet reply).</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="noun" type="xs:string" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The payload.operation.##other also identifies the noun, this element is optionally supplied to simplify processing.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="verb" type="xs:string" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>"create", "delete", "change", etc.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="elementOperation" type="xs:boolean" default="false" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>TRUE if the verb is operating at the element level. In such a case, the verb is to be applied to the elements populated in the payload.operation.##other below. If omitted, assume FALSE.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:any namespace="##other" processContents="skip" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>An XML payload which carries a CIM profile defined using an XSD in a profile-specific namespace. Individual payloads are used collectively to create a series of related operations. See the "enforce" boolean flags in the header for instructions on how to process these messages.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:any> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="OperationSet"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Each operation set is a collection of operations that may require operational-integrity and/or sequence control.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="enforceMsgSequence" type="xs:boolean" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>If set to TRUE, the Operation.##other messages must be processed in the sequence presented. If omitted, assume FALSE.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="enforceTransactionalIntegrity" type="xs:boolean" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Set to TRUE when all of the Operation.##other messages must be processed successfully or else the entire message set must be rolled back. If omitted, assume FALSE.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="Operation" type="OperationType" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> the metered production.</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation><b><i>Additional information:</i></b></xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>There is only one Balance Supplier for each Accounting Point.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="BillingAgent"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The party responsible for invoicing a concerned party.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="BlockEnergyTrader"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>A party that is selling or buying energy on a firm basis (a fixed volume</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>per market time period).</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="CapacityCoordinator"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>A party, acting on behalf of the System Operators involved,</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>responsible for establishing a coordinated Offered Capacity and/or</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>Net Transfer Capacity (NTC) and/or Available Transfer Capacity (ATC) between several Market Balance Areas.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="CapacityTrader"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>A party that has a contract to participate in the Capacity Market to</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>acquire capacity through a Transmission Capacity Allocator.</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation><b><i>Note:</i></b></xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>The capacity may be acquired on behalf of an Interconnection Trade</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>Responsible or for sale on secondary capacity markets.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="Consumer"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>A party that consumes electricity.</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation><b><i>Additional information:</i></b></xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>This is a Type of Party Connected to the Grid.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="ConsumptionResponsibleParty"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>A party who can be brought to rights, legally and financially, for any</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>imbalance between enegry nominated and consumed for all</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>associated Accounting Points.</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation><b><i>Additional information:</i></b></xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>This is a type of Balance Responsible Party.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="ControlAreaOperator"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Responsible for :</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>1. The coordination of exchange programs between its related Market</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>Balance Areas and for the exchanges between its associated Control</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>Areas.</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>2. The load frequency control for its own area.</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>3. The coordination of the correction of time deviations.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="ControlBlockOperator"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Responsible for :</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>1. The coordination of exchanges between its associated Control</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>Blocks and the organisation of the coordination of exchange</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>programs between its related Control Areas.</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>2. The load frequency control within its own block and ensuring that</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>its Control Areas respect their obligations in respect to load frequency</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>control and time deviation.</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>3. The organisation of the settlement and/or compensation between</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>its Control Areas.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="CoordinationCenterOperator"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Responsible for :</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>1. The coordination of exchange programs between its related</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>Control Blocks and for the exchanges between its associated</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>Coordination Center Zones.</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>2. Ensuring that its Control Blocks respect their obligations in respect</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>to load frequency control.</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>3. Calculating the time deviation in cooperation with the associated</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>coordination centers.</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>4. Carrying out the settlement and/or compensation between its</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>Control Blocks and against the other Coordination Center Zones.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="DesignatedDispatchEntity"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Accepts demand response instructions and performs dispatch actions on demand reduction resources. The DDE acts as an intermediary between the demand response management system and the responsive resource.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="GridAccessProvider"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>A party responsible for providing access to the grid through an</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>Accounting Point and its use for energy consumption or production to</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>the Party Connected to the Grid.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="GridOperator"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>A party that operates one or more grids.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="ImbalanceSettlementResponsible"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>A party that is responsible for settlement of the difference between</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>the contracted quantities and the realised quantities of energy</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>products for the Balance Responsible Parties in a Market Balance</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>Area.</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>Note:</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>The Imbalance Settlement Responsible has not the responsibility to</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>invoice. The Imbalance Settlement Responsible may delegate the</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>invoicing responsibility to a more generic role such as a Billing Agent.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="InterconnectionTradeResponsible"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Is a Balance Responsible Party or depends on one. He is recognised</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>by the Nomination Validator for the nomination of already allocated</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>capacity.</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation><b><i>Additional information:</i></b></xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>This is a type of Balance Responsible Party.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="MOLResponsible"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Responsible for the management of the available tenders for all</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>Acquiring</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>System Operators to establish the order of the reserve capacity</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>that can</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>be activated.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="MarketInformationAggregator"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Market Information Aggregator, A party that provides market related</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>information that has been compiled from the figures supplied by</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>different actors in the market. This information may also be published</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>or distributed for general use.</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation><b><i>Note:</i></b></xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>The Market Information Aggregator may receive information from any</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>market participant that is relevant for publication or distribution.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="MarketOperator"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The unique power exchange of trades for the actual delivery of</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>energy that receives the bids from the Balance Responsible Parties</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>that have a contract to bid. The Market Operator determines the</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>market energy price for the Market Balance Area after applying</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>technical constraints from the System Operator. It may also establish</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>the price for the reconciliation within a Metering Grid Area.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="MeterAdministrator"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>A party responsible for keeping a database of meters.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="MeterOperator"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>A party responsible for installing, maintaining, testing, certifying and</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>decommissioning physical meters.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="MeteredDataAggregator"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>A party responsible for the establishment and qualification of metered</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>data from the Metered Data Responsible. This data is aggregated</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>according to a defined set of market rules.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="MeteredDataCollector"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>A party responsible for meter reading and quality control of the</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>reading.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="MeteredDataResponsible"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>A party responsible for the establishment and validation of metered</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>data based on the collected data received from the Metered Data</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>Collector. The party is responsible for the history of metered data for</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>a Metering Point.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="MeteringPointAdministrator"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>A party responsible for registering the parties linked to the metering</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>points in a Metering Grid Area. He is also responsible for maintaining</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>the Metering Point technical specifications. He is responsible for</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>creating and terminating metering points.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="NominationValidator"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Has the responsibility of ensuring that all capacity nominated is within</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>the allowed limits and confirming all valid nominations to all involved</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>parties. He informs the Interconnection Trade Responsible of the</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>maximum nominated capacity allowed. Depending on market rules</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>for a given interconnection the corresponding System Operators may</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>appoint one Nomination Validator.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="PartyConnectedToTheGrid"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>A party that contracts for the right to consume or produce electricity at</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>an Accounting Point.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="Producer"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>A party that produces electricity.</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation><b><i>Additional information:</i></b></xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>This is a type of Party Connected to the Grid.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="ProductionResponsibleParty"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>A party who can be brought to rights, legally and financially, for any</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>imbalance between energy nominated and produced for all</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>associated Accounting Points.</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation><b><i>Additional information:</i></b></xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>This is a type of Balance Responsible Party.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="ReconciliationAccountable"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>A party that is financially accountable for the reconciled volume of</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>energy products for a profiled Accounting Point.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="ReconciliationResponsible"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>A party that is responsible for reconciling, within a Metering Grid</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>Area, the volumes used in the imbalance settlement process for</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>profiled Accounting Points and the actual metered quantities.</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>Note:</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>The Reconciliation Responsible may delegate the invoicing</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>responsibility to a more generic role such as a Billing Agent.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="ReserveAllocator"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Informs the market of reserve requirements, receives tenders against</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>the</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>requirements and in compliance with the prequalification criteria,</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>determines what tenders meet requirements and assigns tenders.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="ResourceProvider"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>A role that manages a resource object and provides the schedules for</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>it</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="SchedulingCoordinator"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>A party that is responsible for the schedule information and its</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>exchange on behalf of a Balance Responsible Party.</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>For example in the Polish market a Scheduling Coordinator is</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>responsible for information interchange for scheduling and</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>settlement.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="SystemOperator"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>A party that is responsible for a stable power system operation</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>(including the organisation of physical balance) through a</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>transmission grid in a geographical area. The System Operator will</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>also determine and be responsible for cross border capacity and</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>exchanges. If necessary he may reduce allocated capacity to ensure</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>operational stability.</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>Transmission as mentioned above means "the transport of electricity</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>on the extra high or high voltage network with a view to its delivery to</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>final customers or to distributors. Operation of transmission includes</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>as well the tasks of system operation concerning its management of</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>energy flows, relibability of the system and availability of all</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>necessary system services." (definition taken from the ENTSO-E</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>RGCE Operation handbook Glossary).</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation><b><i>Note: </i></b>additional obligations may be imposed through local market</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>rules.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="TradeResponsibleParty"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>A party who can be brought to rights, legally and financially, for any</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>imbalance between enegry nominated and consumed for all</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>associated Accounting Points.</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation><b><i>Note:</i></b></xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>A power exchange without any privileged responsibilities acts as a</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>Trade Responsible Party.</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation><b><i>Additional information:</i></b></xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>This is a type of Balance Responsible Party.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="TransmissionCapacityAllocator"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Manages the allocation of transmission capacity for an Allocated</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>Capacity Area.</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation><b><i>For explicit auctions:</i></b></xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>The Transmission Capacity Allocator manages, on behalf of the</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>System Operators, the allocation of available transmission capacity</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>for an Allocated capacity Area. He offers the available transmission</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>capacity to the market, allocates the available transmission capacity</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>to individual Capacity Traders and calculates the billing amount of</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>already allocated capacities to the Capacity Traders.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> Possible values for attribute 'name' are implementation dependent but standard profiles may specify types. An enterprise may have multiple IT systems each having its own local name for the same object, e.g. a planning system may have different names from an EMS. An object may also have different names within the same IT system, e.g. localName as defined in CIM version 14. The definition from CIM14 is:</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>The localName is a human readable name of the object.
